definitions.definition: To move with rhythmic steps or movements, especially in time to music.
examples: I danced with her all night long.
These drum beats are making me dance !

definitions.definition: To leap or move lightly and rapidly.
examples: His eyes danced with pleasure as he spoke.   She accused her political opponent of dancing around the issue instead of confronting it.
Have you ever danced the tango?

definitions.definition: To cause to dance, or move nimbly or merrily about.
To make love or have sex .
examples: You make me feel like dancing .

definitions.definition: To make a repetitive movement in order to communicate to other worker honey bees .
definitions.label_groups: beekeeping , of a worker honey bee

definitions.definition: To kick and convulse from the effects of being hanged.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To move with rhythmic steps or movements, especially in time to music.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To leap or move lightly and rapidly.
( transitive ) To perform the steps to.
( transitive ) To cause to dance, or move nimbly or merrily about.
( figurative , euphemistic ) To make love or have sex .
( beekeeping , of a worker honey bee ) To make a repetitive movement in order to communicate to other worker honey bees .
( figurative , euphemistic ) To kick and convulse from the effects of being hanged.
